results.definition: the form of a word that is used to denote a singleton

examples: such poise is singular in one so young

results.definition: beyond or deviating from the usual or expected
examples: her speech has a funny twang
they have some funny ideas about war
the peculiar aromatic odor of cloves
something definitely queer about this town

results.definition: being a single and separate person or thing
examples: can the singular person be understood apart from his culture?
every fact in the world might be singular...unlike any other fact and sole of its kind"-William James

results.definition: composed of one member, set, or kind
grammatical number category referring to a single item or unit
the single one of its kind
examples: the unique existing example of Donne's handwriting
a unique copy of an ancient manuscript
certain types of problems have unique solutions
